Body:
I am trying to detect/record sound using raspberry Pi,looks like raspberry pi supports audio out but not in,Please can some one suggest better USB soundcard and microphone available for raspberry pi.

BR, &Sanumala
This has nothing to do with programming. Please use following site for your question: http://raspberrypi.stackexchange.com
I use an usb card : creative sound blaster S81140, but yes this have nothing to do with programming. And i use a microphone composite (alimented via battery).
I've not tried microphones, but probable an USB microphone compatible with Debian should work inside RPi...

There are currently two good GPIO sound cards which allow audio input and have microphones built in : The audio injector sound card (has great support) and the Cirrus Logic audio card.

You can find a partial list of sound cards for the Raspberry Pi on eLinux. Search for RPi_Expansion_Boards#Sound.

"
